Package imagingbook.lib.image.data

Class PixelPack

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack
  • public class PixelPack
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a generic data container for scalar and vector-valued images, using float-values throughout. Its primary use is in the GenericFilter framework.
    Version:
    2021/01/14

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  PixelPack.PixelSlice
      Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) pixel slice of a (vector-valued) PixelPack.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description

      The default out-of-bounds strategy (see OutOfBoundsStrategy).

      float[][] getArrays()
      Returns a reference to this PixelPack's internal data array, which is always two-dimensional: dimension 1 is the slice index, dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).

    • Field Detail

      • DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy

        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy
        The default out-of-bounds strategy (see OutOfBoundsStrategy).

    • Constructor Detail

      • PixelPack

        public PixelPack​(int width,
                 int height,
                 int depth,
                 OutOfBoundsStrategy obs)
        Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
        Parameters:
        width - the image width
        height - the image height
        depth - the number of channels (slices)
        obs - the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates

      • PixelPack

        public PixelPack​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given ImageProcessor object. Uses DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy as the out-of-bounds strategy (see OutOfBoundsStrategy).
        Parameters:
        ip - the source image

      • PixelPack

        public PixelPack​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip,
                 OutOfBoundsStrategy obs)
        Creates a pack of pixel data from the given ImageProcessor object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
        Parameters:
        ip - the source image
        obs - the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates

      • PixelPack

        public PixelPack​(PixelPack orig)
        Constructor. Duplicates an existing PixelPack without copying the contained pixel data.
        Parameters:
        orig - the original PixelPack

      • PixelPack

        public PixelPack​(PixelPack orig,
                 boolean copyData)
        Constructor. Duplicates an existing PixelPack, optionally copying the contained pixel data.
        Parameters:
        orig - the original PixelPack
        copyData - set true to copy pixel data

    • Method Detail

      • getVec

        public float[] getVec​(int u,
                      int v,
                      float[] vals)
        Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a float-vector. If the supplied array is non-null, it is filled in and returned, otherwise a new array is returned. The length of this array corresponds to the number of slices in this pixel pack. The values returned at out-of-bounds positions depends on this pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
        Parameters:
        u - the x-position
        v - the y-position
        vals - a suitable
        Returns:
        the array of pixel data

      • getVec

        public float[] getVec​(int u,
                      int v)

      • setVec

        public void setVec​(int u,
                   int v,
                   float... vals)
        Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position. The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices in this pixel pack.
        Parameters:
        u - the x-position
        v - the y-position
        vals - a float vector with the values for this pixel

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo​(PixelPack other)
        Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another. The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
        Parameters:
        other - another pixel pack

      • isCompatibleTo

        public boolean isCompatibleTo​(PixelPack other)
        Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
        Parameters:
        other - the other pixel pack
        Returns:
        true if both have the same dimensions

      • isCompatibleTo

        public boolean isCompatibleTo​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as the specified ImageProcessor instance, i.e., can be copied to it.
        Parameters:
        ip - the image processor instance
        Returns:
        true if compatible

      • getSlice

        public PixelPack.PixelSlice getSlice​(int k)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a reference to the specified PixelPack.PixelSlice. An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
        Parameters:
        k - the slice index (0,...,K-1)
        Returns:
        a reference to the pixel slice
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getEmptySlice

        public PixelPack.PixelSlice getEmptySlice()
        Creates and returns a new PixelPack.PixelSlice with the same dimensions and out-of-bounds strategy as this PixelPack.
        Returns:
        a new pixel slice

      • getArrays

        public float[][] getArrays()
        Returns a reference to this PixelPack's internal data array, which is always two-dimensional: dimension 1 is the slice index, dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
        Returns:
        the pixel pack's data array

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the associated image.
        Returns:
        the image width

        Returns:
        the image height

        public int getDepth()
        Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
        Returns:
        the image depth

      • getOutOfBoundsStrategy

        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy()
        Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
        Returns:

      • zero

        public void zero()
        Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.

      • get3x3Neighborhood

        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood​(int uc,
                                      int vc,
                                      float[][][] nh)
        Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the specified position. The returned float-array has the structure [x][y][k], with x,y = 0,...,2 and k is the slice index.
        Parameters:
        uc - the center x-position
        vc - the center x-position
        nh - a float array to be filled in (or null)
        Returns:
        the neighborhood array

      • copyToImageProcessor

        public void copyToImageProcessor​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied ImageProcessor instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        ip - the target image processor

      • copyFromImageProcessor

        public static void copyFromImageProcessor​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip,
                                          PixelPack pack)
        Utility method. Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing pixel pack. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
        Parameters:
        ip - the image processor to be copied
        pack - the receiving pixel pack

      • copyToImageProcessor

        public static void copyToImageProcessor​(PixelPack pack,
                                        ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
        Parameters:
        pack - the source pixel pack
        ip - the receiving image processor
